author: nurmukhametov
message:
PR #33361: [ROCm] Fix exp accuracy on complex inputs

Imported from GitHub PR https://github.com/openxla/xla/pull/33361

This PR improves the accuracy of complex exponential implementation in the elemental IR emitter. The corresponding test is included in `xla/tests/complex_unary_op_test.cc`.

Note: it is better to merge it after #33212, otherwise the test verifies the C++ standard library exp accuracy. Moreover, I tested it locally with `--xla_cpu_use_fusion_emitters=false` on CPU, otherwise it tests MLIR complex.exp accuracy which was fixed in https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pull/164952.
Copybara import of the project:

--
de60c55cdf49925024398b93e65a92f0836cbef5 by Aleksei Nurmukhametov <anurmukh@amd.com>:

Fix exp accuracy on complex inputs

Improve accuracy of complex exponential implementation in elemental IR
emitter. The corresponding test is included in xla/tests/complex_unary_op_test.cc

Merging this change closes #33361

PiperOrigin-RevId: 834322514

files.patch:
@@ -57,10 +57,10 @@ def main():
   default_extra_prec_multiplier = 1
 
   blocks = []
-  for opname in ['Log1p', 'Tan', 'Asin', 'Asinh']:
+  for opname in ['Log1p', 'Tan', 'Asin', 'Asinh', 'Exp']:
     mpmath_op = opname.lower()
     mpmath_op = dict(asin='arcsin', asinh='arcsinh').get(mpmath_op, mpmath_op)
-    size_re, size_im = dict(Log1p=(7, 7), Tan=(7, 7)).get(
+    size_re, size_im = dict(Log1p=(7, 7), Tan=(7, 7), Exp=(7, 7)).get(
         opname, (default_size, default_size)
     )
     extra_prec_multiplier = dict(
@@ -70,6 +70,7 @@ def main():
         # available
         Asin=20,
         Asinh=20,
+        Exp=1,
     ).get(opname, default_extra_prec_multiplier)
     nmp = jtu.numpy_with_mpmath(
         mpmath, extra_prec_multiplier=extra_prec_multiplier
